subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 19; For I know my transgressions, and my sins are always before me. (Psalms 51: 3)
reflection: Sometimes we ask the Lord to adjust our circumstances or to change people instead of asking Him to deal with us. Praying about our spiritual growth becomes effective ONLY when we first come clean with God. LET'S SETTLE FOR NOTHING LESS THAN TOTAL HONESTY WHEN WE TALK WITH THE LORD.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/2/2019;

_For I know my transgressions, and my sins are always _

_before me._ (Ps. 51:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Sometimes we ask the Lord to adjust our circumstances

or to change people instead of asking Him to deal with

us. Praying about our spiritual growth becomes effective

ONLY when we first come clean with God.

LET'S SETTLE FOR NOTHING LESS THAN TOTAL HONESTY WHEN WE

TALK WITH THE LORD.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Surely God is my Help; the Lord is the one who sustains me. (Psalms 54: 4)
reflection: When life has you down--whether through sorrow that seems to hard to bear or circumstance that make each day a morning-to-night grind--my friend's advice can help. But first, let God pull you up by His power (Psalms 54: 1-4). Then. hold on to His hand. Trust His power and hold on. HE WILL GIVE YOU THE STRENGTH TO KEEP FROM FALLING. (ISA. 40: 31)
original_content:
VERSE FOR 2/2/2019:

_Surely God is my Help; the Lord is the one who_

_sustains me. _(Ps. 54:4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When life has you down--whether through sorrow that

seems to hard to bear or circumstance that make each day

a morning-to-night grind--my friend's advice can help. But

first, let God pull you up by His power (Ps. 54:1-4). Then.

hold on to His hand. Trust His power and hold on.

HE WILL GIVE YOU THE STRENGTH TO KEEP FROM FALLING. (ISA. 40:31)

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The eternal God is your refuge, and underneath are the everlasting arms. (Deut. 33: 27)
reflection: Once you have begun to walk with God, you need only keep on walking with Him, and all of life becomes one long stroll. As we sense the strength of God's everlasting arms beneath us (Deut. 33: 27), we can stroll through life with confidence, holding the hand of our unseen Companion. YOU CAN BE CONFIDENT ABOUT TOMORROW IF YOU WALK WITH GOD TODAY. PASTOR AL

_the everlasting arms. _(Deut. 33:27)

keep on walking with Him, and all of life becomes one

long stroll. As we sense the strength of God's everlasting

arms beneath us (Deut. 33:27), we can stroll through life

with confidence, holding the hand of our unseen Companion.

YOU CAN BE CONFIDENT ABOUT TOMORROW IF YOU WALK WITH

GOD TODAY.

_PASTOR AL__ _

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I will sing of Your strength, in the morning I will sing of Your love. (Psalms 59: 16)
reflection: the power of music to heal and help is a gift from God that comforts many. Perhaps that is why the Psalmist speaks so deeply to us. There we find lyrics that connects with our hearts, allowing us to speak to God form the depth of our hearts. MAY OUR GOD GIVE US A SONG TODAY THAT WILL REMIND US OF HIS GREATNESS, NO MATTER WHAT WE MAY FACE.

of our hearts.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Truly my soul finds rest in God; my salvation comes from Him. (Psalms 62: 1)
reflection: I love a quiet time on a Sunday morning before church service in order to push worldly thoughts from mind. Today we live in a noisy world, even many church services leave little time for quiet reflection. The psalmist's words are truly relevant in our noisy world today, so that we may meet the living God and hear him speak. LET US TURN DOWN THE WORLD'S VOLUME SO THAT WE MAY HEAR GOD'S VOICE. PASTOR AL.

VERSE FOR 2/6/2019:

_Truly my soul finds rest in God; my salvation comes_

LET US TURN DOWN THE WORLD'S VOLUME SO THAT WE MAY HEAR GOD'S VOICE.

_PASTOR AL._

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Let heaven and earth praise Him, the seas and all that move in them. (Psalms 69: 34)
reflection: When we grow to understand the wonder of creation, it must always point us to the Creator Himself, and call us to worship Him. If creation itself gives praise to the Creator, we can and certainly should join in the chorus. WHAT A MIGHTY GOD WE SERVE!

WHAT A MIGHTY GOD WE SERVE!

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 19 From birth I have relied on You; You brought me forth from my mother's womb. I will ever praise You. (Psalms 71: 6)
reflection: Are you in life's springtime? Trust God's timing to fulfill your dreams. Are you in life's summer or winter? Face your daily challenges head on. If you feel winters chill, Concentrate on knowing God better. HIS PRESENCE WILL MAKE EVERY SEASON OF LIFE ONE OF STRENGTH AND BEAUTY.

VERSE FOR 3/8/2019

_From birth I have relied on You; You brought me forth_

_from my mother's womb. I will ever praise You. _(Ps. 71:6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Are you in life's springtime? Trust God's timing to fulfill

your dreams. Are you in life's summer or winter? Face your

daily challenges head on. If you feel winters chill, Concentrate

on knowing God better.

HIS PRESENCE WILL MAKE EVERY SEASON OF LIFE ONE OF STRENGTH

AND BEAUTY.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Let us draw near to God. . . with the full assurance that faith brings. ((Hebrews 10: 22)
reflection: In the O. T. , access to God in the tabernacle and the temple was strictly limited. Only priests could go in through the curtain and offer sacrifices in the holy place. Now because of Christ's sacrifice for our sins, all those who love and follow Him can come into His presence at any time. HE HAS GIVEN US THE RIGHT OF ACCESS.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 3/9/2019:

_Let us draw near to God. . . with the full assurance_

_that faith brings. _((Heb. 10:22)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In the O. T. , access to God in the tabernacle and the temple

was strictly limited. Only priests could go in through the curtain

and offer sacrifices in the holy place.Now because of Christ's

sacrifice for our sins, all those who love and follow Him can come

into His presence at any time. HE HAS GIVEN US THE RIGHT OF ACCESS.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: He was looking forward to the city with foundations, whose architect and builder is God. (Hebrews 11: 10)
reflection: Abraham left all that he knew as he obeyed the Lord's call to live as a foreigner and stranger in a new land (Genesis 12: 1). He pressed through the cultural challenges while keeping his faith in God, and 2, 000 years later the writer to the Hebrews called him a hero. Perhaps you've always lived in the same town, but as Christ's follower you are still a foreigner or stranger on this earth. GOD CALLS US TO LIVE BY FAITH. PASTOR AL.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 3/10/2019:

_He was looking forward to the city with foundations,_

_whose architect and builder is God. _(Heb. 11:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Abraham left all that he knew as he obeyed the Lord's call

to live as a foreigner and stranger in a new land (Gen. 12:1).

He pressed through the cultural challenges while keeping his

faith in God, and 2,000 years later the writer to the Hebrews

called him a hero. Perhaps you've always lived in the same

town, but as Christ's follower you are still a foreigner or

stranger on this earth. GOD CALLS US TO LIVE BY FAITH.

_PASTOR AL._

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: When the Lord takes pleasure in anyone's way, He causes their enemies to make peace with them. (Proverbs 16: 7)
reflection: When we have been offended, it's good to compare our instincts with God's intent for human behavior. We may be inclined to strike at people verbally, isolate ourselves, or escape through any number of ways. HOWEVER, choosing a gracious response will help us avoid regret, and most important it will please God. WE CAN ENDURE LIFE'S WRONGS BECAUSE WE KNOW THAT GOD WILL MAKE THINGS RIGHT.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 3/11/2019:

_When the Lord takes pleasure in anyone's way, He causes _

_their enemies to make peace with them. _(Pro. 16:7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When we have been offended, it's good to compare our instincts

with God's intent for human behavior. We may be inclined to

strike at people verbally, isolate ourselves, or escape through

any number of ways. HOWEVER, choosing a gracious response

will help us avoid regret, and most important it will please God.

WE CAN ENDURE LIFE'S WRONGS BECAUSE WE KNOW THAT GOD WILL

MAKE THINGS RIGHT.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Let us run with perseverance the race marked out for us, fixing our eyes on Jesus, the pioneer and perfecter of faith. (Hebrews 12: 1, 2)
reflection: When the problems of life cloud our vision we have an opportunity to learn to see our goal with eyes of faith. The N. T. letter to the Hebrews urges us to run with perseverance the race marked out for us. when we feel like quitting, this is our signal to remember not only what Jesus suffered for us but now helps us to endure--until the day we see Him face to face. WE CAN FINISH STRONG WHEN WE FOCUS ON HIM.

WE CAN FINISH STRONG WHEN WE FOCUS ON HIM.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Come with Me by yourselves to a quiet place and get some rest. (Mark 6: 31)
reflection: In Exodus 18 we see that Moses was wearing himself out serving alone as judge over the Israelites. His Father-in-law warned Moses that his workload was to heavy, and suggested that he delegate some of the work to others. Now in Mark 6: 30, 31 Jesus often slipped away to rest and pray. When we follow His example, we will be more effective in our relationships and better able to give care to others. DON'T TRY TO DO EVERYTHING, TAKE TIME TO REFRESH YOUR BODY AND SPIRIT.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 3/13/2019:

Jesus often slipped away to rest and pray. When we follow

and better able to give care to others.DON'T TRY TO DO EVERYTHING,

TAKE TIME TO REFRESH YOUR BODY AND SPIRIT.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: We do not have a high priest who is unable to empathize with our weakness, (Hebrews 4: 15)
reflection: Jesus knew what it was like to lose His personal space in the commotion of crowds desperate to see and touch Him. A woman who had suffered from constant bleeding for 12 years and could not find a cure touched the fringe of His robe and was healed immediately. Jesus felt the power come out of Him. While some of us wish to keep our personal space and privacy, the only way to help a world of hurting people is to let them get close enough to be touched by encouragement, comfort, and the grace of Christ in us. A CHRISTIAN'S LIFE IS THE WINDOW THROUGH WHICH OTHERS CAN SEE JESUS.

OTHERS CAN SEE JESUS.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The Lord lifts up those who are bow down. (Psalms 146: 8)
reflection: It is so easy to become spiritually bow down by the burdens of life. So often we find ourselves discouraged by the problems we face and the needs of those we love. But if we consider God's care, His great power, and His loving heart, we can began to look up and praise Him. We can walk through each day knowing that the "Lord reigns forever. (Psalms 146: 10) HE LIFTS US UP WHEN WE ARE BOWED DOWN. PRAISE THE LORD.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Your heavenly Father feeds [the birds of the air]. Are you not much more valuable then they? (Matthew 6: 26)
reflection: Loneliness can make us feel unseen by others--and maybe even by God. But we must remind ourselves that even though we may feel forgotten by our Creator God, we are not. God not only made us in His image (Genesis 1: 26-27), yes He also values each of us, Even in our darkest hours, we can rest in the knowledge that we are never alone, but our loving God is with us. IF WE WEREN'T DEEPLY LOVED, WOULD GOD HAVE SENT HIS SON TO SAVE US.
original_content:

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 19; FOR YOU HAVE BEEN GIVEN NOT ONLY THE PRIVILEGE OF TRUSTING IN CHRIST BUT ALSO THE PRIVILEGE OF SUFFERING FOR HIM. (PHIL. 1: 29)
reflection: When we suffer for our faith, it doesn't mean that we have done something wrong. In fact, the opposite is often true--it verifies that we have been faithful. USE SUFFERING TO BUILD YOUR CHARACTER.

VERSE FOR 3/17/2019;

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When we suffer for our faith, it doesn't mean that we

have done something wrong. In fact, the opposite is

often true--it verifies that we have been faithful.

USE SUFFERING TO BUILD YOUR CHARACTER.

_ PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: God is faithful; He will not allow you to be tempted beyond what you can bear. (I Corinthians 10: 13)
reflection: Temptation has aways of often knocking at our door. Sometimes from our own desires, other times through the situations and people we encounter. Now the "way out" may include removing the objects of temptation or fleeing from them. OUR BEST COURSE OF ACTION MAY BE TO SIMPLY WALK AWAY--AND FLEE TO GOD.

VERSE FOR 3/18/2019:

people we encounter. Now the "way out" may include removing

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 19; If god is for us who can be against us? (Romans 31 b)
reflection: Do you ever think that because you are not good enough for God, He will not save you? Do you ever feel as if salvation is for every one else and not for you? If God gave His Son for you; He isn't going to hold back the gift of salvation. HE WILL NOT HOLD BACK ANYTHING YOU NEED TO LIVE FOR HIM.

is for every one else and not for you? If God gave His Son

for you; He isn't going to hold back the gift of salvation.

HE WILL NOT HOLD BACK ANYTHING YOU NEED TO LIVE FOR HIM.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I became a servant of this gospel by the gift of god's grace. (Eph. 3: 9)
reflection: Saul--who later became Paul, must have truly been surprised when he had been killing the followers of Christ and now Christ Himself chose Paul to become Christ's servant. Have you become surprised by God's gift of grace in your life as He shows you His love and forgiveness? NEVER MEASURE GOD'S UNLIMITED POWER BY YOUR LIMITED EXPECTATIONS.

chose Paul to become Christ's servant. Have you become surprised

forgiveness?

NEVER MEASURE GOD'S UNLIMITED POWER BY YOUR LIMITED EXPECTATIONS.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Live as children of the light, (Eph. 5: 8)
reflection: Scriptures say that believers are children of the light. This means that we need to live in the full light of God's presence to thrive (Psalms 89: 15). If we try to live in darkness, we will produce nothing but "fruitless deeds" (see Eph. 5: 3-4). But if we are living in the light of Jesus, who is the Light of the world, WE WILL PRODUCE THE FRUIT OF HIS LIGHT, WHICH IS GOOD, FAITHFUL, AND TRUE.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 3/21/2019:

_Live as children of the light, _(Eph. 5:8)

to thrive (Ps. 89:15). If we try to live in darkness, we will

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 19 Set your eyes on things above, not on earthly things (Colossians 3: 2) (READ COL. 3: 1-11)
reflection: Our life on earth is like the pregame in basketball. Life is interesting and full of promise, but it doesn't compare to what lies ahead, just think of the pleasure of knowing that when life is good, the best is yet to come! Or that when we give cheerfully to those in need, it's an investment in heavenly treasure. In times of suffering and sorrow, we can find hope as we reflect on the truth that a pain-free, tireless eternity awaits us, LIVING FOR THE FUTURE PUTS TODAY IN PERSPECTIVE.
original_content:

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: [Christ] went through the greater and more perfect tabernacle that is not made with human hands. (Hebrews 9: 11)
reflection: The work Christ would accomplish on our behalf, He did it so that "those who are called may receive the promised eternal inheritance. " (Vs. 15) Jesus invites us to be a part of His story. JESUS TOOK OUR SIN THAT WE MIGHT HAVE SALVATION.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I will strength you and keep you. (Isaiah 41: 10)
reflection: At times, God may allow our resources to dwindle so that we rely on His strength to keep going. Our needs showcase His power, but He is the One who says, "I will strengthen you and help you; I will uphold you with My righteous right hand. " GOD WANTS US TO DEPEND ON HIS STRENGTH, NOT OUR OWN.

GOD WANTS US TO DEPEND ON HIS STRENGTH, NOT OUR OWN.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: In the beginning was the word. . . . Through Him all things were made. (John 1: 1, 3)
reflection: John tells us, "The Word became flesh and made His dwelling among us. We have seen His glory. " (John 1: 14) Out of that eyewitness experience John also wrote, "We proclaim to you the one who existed from the beginning, whom we have heard and seen. . . He is the Word of life. " (I John 1: 1). Like John we can use our words to introduce others to Jesus whom wind and water obey. LET US ACKNOWLEDGE THE CREATOR TO OTHER, WHO KNOWS AND LOVES HIS CREATION.
original_content:

AND LOVES HIS CREATION.

_ PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: It is not the healthy who need a doctor, but the sick. (Mark 2: 17)
reflection: Yes Jesus came to save sinners, which includes all of us. He loves us, He welcomes us into His presence, and calls us to follow Him. If we will walk with Him, we will grow more and more spiritually fit. It is up to us to reach out to those who need a Savior. JESUS'S ARMS OF WELCOME ARE ALWAYS OPEN.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The Lord is good and His love endures forever. (Psalms 100:3)
reflection: We need to remember that we were fashioned from dust in the hands of our Creator, and led like sheep into green pasture (vs. 5). We, His people, have a loving Savior. What a picture, have of, a good, loving, and faithful God we have. No wonder it will take forever to enjoy His greatness. LET US THANK GOD FOR LIFE, FOR JOY, FOR PROTECTION, AND FOR PROMISING US A FUTURE WITH HIM FOREVER.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: In all your ways submit to Him, and He will make your paths straight. (Proverbs 3: 6)
reflection: In moral and spiritual areas of our life, we can foolishly pursue dangerous things God tells us to avoid because of His love for us. Instead of following the ways of the world, a wiser approach would be to read the book of Proverbs, which contains many positive ways to elude the snares of life. LET US FOLLOW THE LORD'S GUIDANCE EACH DAY. . .

Instead of following the ways of the world, a wiser approach

would be to read the book of Proverbs,which contains many

positive ways to elude the snares of life.

LET US FOLLOW THE LORD'S GUIDANCE EACH DAY. . .

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: They went to a place called Gethsemane. (Mark 14: 32)
reflection: The word Gethsemane means "place of the olive press, "and that perfectly describes those first crushing hours of Christ's suffering on OUR behalf. There, "in anguish, He prayed. . . and His sweat was like drops of blood (Luke 22: 44). Jesus suffered and died "to take away the sins of the world" (John 1: 29). In so doing He restored our broken relationship with the Father. GONE MY TRANSGRESSIONS, AND NOW I AM FREE-ALL BECAUSE JESUS WAS WOUNDED FOR ME.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 3/29/2019:

_They went to a place called Gethsemane. _(Mk. 14:32)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The word _Gethsemane _means "place of the olive press,"and

that perfectly describes those first crushing hours of Christ's

suffering on OUR behalf. There, "in anguish, He prayed. . .

and His sweat was like drops of blood (Lk. 22:44). Jesus

suffered and died "to take away the sins of the world" (Jn.

1:29). In so doing He restored our broken relationship with

the Father. GONE MY TRANSGRESSIONS, AND NOW I AM FREE-ALL BECAUSE JESUS WAS WOUNDED FOR ME.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The Holy Spirit helps us in our distress. For we don't even know what we should pray for, nor how we should pray. (Romans 8: 26)
reflection: As a believer we are not left to our own resources to cop with problems. Even when you do not know the right words to pray, the Holy Spirit will pray with and for you, and God will answer. With God helping you pray, you don't need to be afraid to come before Him. WE CAN BE CONFIDENT OF OUR SALVATION.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 3/30/2019:

_The Holy Spirit helps us in our distress. For we don't_

_even know what we should pray for, nor how we should _

_pray. _(Ro. 8:26)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

As a believer we are not left to our own resources to cop

with problems. Even when you do not know the right words

to pray, the Holy Spirit will pray with and for you, and God

will answer. With God helping you pray, you don't need to be

afraid to come before Him. WE CAN BE CONFIDENT OF OUR SALVATION.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus cried out in a loud voice. . . My God, My God, why have You forsaken Me? (Matthew 27: 46)
reflection: Isolation is the agony Christ suffered when His eternal relationship with the Father was broken on the cross. We hear this in His cry captured in (Matthew 27: 46) About three in the afternoon Jesus cried out 'Eli. Eli, lema sabachthani?' (which means, 'My God, my God, why have you forsaken Me?' As He suffered and died under the burden of our sins, Christ was suddenly alone. THOSE WHO KNOW JESUS ARE NEVER ALONE.
original_content:
THE VERSE FOR 3/31/2019:

_Jesus cried out in a loud voice. . . "My God, My God, why _

_have You forsaken Me? (_Mt 27:46)

READ PSALM 22:1-10

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Isolation is the agony Christ suffered when His eternal

relationship with the Father was broken on the cross. We

hear this in His cry captured in (Mt. 27:46) "About three

in the afternoon Jesus cried out 'Eli. Eli, lema sabachthani?'

(which means, 'My God, my God, why have you forsaken

Me?' As He suffered and died under the burden of our sins,

Christ was suddenly alone.

THOSE WHO KNOW JESUS ARE NEVER ALONE.

_PASTOR AL_

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Do not work for food that spoils, but for food that endures to eternal life. (John 6: 27)
reflection: Jesus's kingdom, of course, is "not of the world" (John 18: 36) The crowd mistakenly thought "King" Jesus would give them full stomachs and natural freedom. But Jesus counseled them, AND US: "Do not work for food that spoils, but for food that endures to eternal life" (v. 27). CHRIST IS THE BREAD OF ETERNAL LIFE.
original_content:
VERSE FOR 4/1/2019:

_Do not work for food that spoils, but for food_

_that endures to eternal life. _(Jn. 6:27)

READ JN. 6:22-34)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Jesus's kingdom, of course, is "not of the world" (Jn. 18:36)

The crowd mistakenly thought "King" Jesus would give them

full stomachs and natural freedom. But Jesus counseled them,

AND US: "Do not work for food that spoils, but for food that

endures to eternal life" (v. 27).

CHRIST IS THE BREAD OF ETERNAL LIFE.

_PASTOR AL_
